boardgame.name: The Old Ruins
boardgame.description:
User summary:

The game combines traditional board game play with a fantasy table-top adventure of a dungeon. The usual function of a dungeon master is replaced by a series of random tables that determine the dungeon layout, enemies, and treasures. Players take turns generating dungeon segments. The party explores the area collaboratively or singly, as desired. The goal is to collect two items of "technology" (treasure) and return to the surface.

Note the cover page on the PDF document is very large; the remaining pages are standard US letter.

boardgame.name: Munchkin Collectible Card Game
boardgame.description:
GAME SYSTEM



This entry is to allow for discussion/rating of the game system as a whole. It is not for a specific product or release. Versions will appear on the individual item pages.





Eric Lang and Kevin Wilson deliver a completely new design in the Munchkin universe: a stand-alone, two-player collectible card game that holds up to competitive-level play but still retains the goofy silliness for which Munchkin is famous.

Munchkin Collectible Card Game is a combat game in which two players level up turn after turn, put loot into play to give themselves benefits, and attack (or bluff attacks!) against one another. Eliminate the other player first, and you win! In the words of co-designer Eric Lang, "'[Munchkin Collectible Card Game] is a very different game from Munchkin. Imagine all the awesome humor of Munchkin as a short, competitive head-to-head slugfest."

The card game will be distributed as fixed two-player starter sets and randomized booster expansions.

boardgame.name: Virulence
Virulence: An Infectious Card Game
boardgame.description:
Virulence: An Infectious Card Game is an addictively quick and simple card game focused on viruses infecting a host cell - and how they assemble and replicate inside that host cell.

Virulence has players take on the role of viruses competing to infect a host cell in order to replicate their own viral components, thus scoring points.

Each round, players secretly choose one Virus card from their hand, place it face down on the table, then simultaneously flip these Virus cards to reveal each player's (and thus each virus') virulence. In order from the highest to the lowest virulence, players then take turns selecting from the available Viral Component cards, each awarding points in a variety of ways, or allowing that player to build their hand of Virus Cards allowing them to win critical components later.

Virulence is addictively simple and competitive because it combines blind bidding/bluffing, with engine building, a bit of luck and, most importantly, it can played be taught in 30 seconds, and played 10 minutes.

boardgame.name: Strongholds
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

What do you think of when you imagine a stronghold? Typically, a stronghold is a fortified structure such as a castle or a keep but it can basically be anything you want; a temple or monastery, a tower, a cave complex, a mansion, an island, or even a giant hollowed tree. In Dungeon World terms, a stronghold is not a steading, it does not have its own economy nor a thriving population (although it could and if you take care of it, it really should. You shouldn’t be surprised if you see that some villagers have built houses around your keep while you were away). A stronghold is your base of operations, your command post, your headquarters, your fortress of solitude, it is where you store your loot and where you go to lick your wounds after a fearsome battle.

Strongholds contains guidelines on how to build and acquire strongholds and what to equip them with.

This product contains two files:

A 20 page guidebook containing guidelines to build strongholds
A two page sheet for you to record your stronghold's tags and chambers

boardgame.name: Men & Monsters of the Aegean
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Men & Monsters of the Aegean is Skirmisher Publishing's first title for the BASH Fantasy role-playing game system. It presents a dozen player character races and 30 types of monster, with multiple variants for many of them, all inspired by the myths and legends of the Classical world and each with an Adventure Hook and background information integrating it into the setting.

New races include the hulking Antaeans, the Myrmidons who followed Achilles in the Trojan War, and the dog-head Cynocephalians. Monsters include everything from familiar creatures like the Cyclops, Manticore, Pegasus, and Sphinx to more exotic ones like the Drakon, Empusa, Hippalectryon, Ophiotaurus, and Sea Leopard.

This fully-illustrated manual also includes sections on using existing creatures in an Aegean campaign, encounter tables, and new items, powers, advantages, and disadvantages for the BASH system.

All of the monsters presented in this book are associated with the system-free Swords of Kos Fantasy Campaign Setting, a milieu is set in a re-imagined Mediterranean, and can be easily incorporated into games that use it or other settings altogether. Here, the Gods of Olympus reign, their heroes acting as agents of their will or exemplars of their glory. A century before, the Titans began a war that nearly destroyed the world and this Cataclysm changed everything, returning monsters to the earth, allowing the dead to roam, sinking islands, shattering cities, upsetting the cosmic balance. As the monsters returned, so too did the Elves, Dwarves, Gnomes, Elementals, Giants, Dragons, Satyrs, Goblins, and Orcs, striding, creeping, skulking or marching back into the world from distant realms or deep fastness, rejoining the world they had left behind.

boardgame.name: The Streets of Commonville
boardgame.description:
From the publisher:

Commonville. A dangerous place to be. Especially since a callous murderer has gone into hiding within its maze of streets. With a warning given to police that if they don’t call off their manhunt within an hour, another innocent civilian will pay the price. It’s up to you and your team to discover which of the 12 suspects is the offender, where they are hiding, which weapon was used on the victim, and arrest him/her before the time runs out.

In this game, each member of the team gets to play as one of Commonville's finest, exploring the city, consisting of tiles. Each tile contains either a suspect, evidence that can be used to eliminate suspects, or something to assist you in solving the case in time.

During each round, each player will roll a varying amount of dice up to 3 times. You may then use the dice for movement (by matching the number on the destination tile), for gathering evidence (with any 4 consecutive dice), and for getting assistance (with any 3 matching dice). Donuts can be used to perform special dice actions (such as passing a die to another player). There is also a special blue Investigation die that can be used to perform actions rapidly (but only by the lead detective). After performing any actions, the team must move the time marker down a number of spaces equal to the number shown on the time die plus 1 minute for every wild 6 that was used for an action.

There are 12 possible suspects in the game. Once you have collected enough evidence to eliminate 11 of them (and found the weapon that was used on the last victim), you must collect an Arrest Warrant from the Police Precinct and arrest the remaining suspect. If you can do all of this before time runs out, the team wins the game.

boardgame.name: Uzumaku Campaign
渦巻くキャンペーン
boardgame.description:
User summary
In the game of 渦巻くキャンペーン (Uzumaku Campaign), players are candidates for the next US President, and struggle to win the election.

There are four influence types: Popularity, Economy, Military, and Religion.

They go on a stumping tour to States such as New York, Florida, and Pennsylvania. In these States, they build influence of specific type, gain supporters spending influence, control votes per supporter, and obstruct opponents by negative campaigns.

At the end of game, number of votes is calculated according to number of supporters and votes per supporter ratio for each influence type, modified by undecided votes. The player with the greatest number of votes wins the election.

With little card text and no special powers, this gamers' game requires you to adopt various influence management tactics according to opponents' moves.

Publisher's summary
プレイヤーが大統領選挙に出馬して、選挙を勝ち抜くゲームです。
ニューヨーク、フロリダやペンシルバニアといった都市を回って

Be the first to run out of cards!

Zoop is a fun discard game in which the players must use their wits and skills to combine their animals and win the game. During their turn, players have to discard one card that shares at least two of the three characteristics — number of animals, color, and type of animal — of the last card played. The first player to run out of cards wins!

boardgame.name: German Rails
boardgame.description:
You are a German Industrialist competing with other German Industrialists in the creation of the newly invented railroads. Invest wisely in the creation and expansion of these railroads, accruing victory points in the process while reaping monetary dividends from your well considered decisions. German Rails lasts about an hour with 3 to 5 players, most Victory Points wins the game. Money is just a tool, albeit a very important tool in building the railroads of Germany!

German Rails is a reimplementation of Gulf, Mobile & Ohio on a German map. The dividend payments have been simplified to fixed $4 per share and there are fewer exceptions (Gulf, Mobile & Ohio had two-VP companies, which are not present here).

boardgame.name: Blood Before Richmond: Beaver Dam Creek – Battles of the Seven Days
boardgame.description:
Beaver Dam Creek is the fourth game in the Blood Before Richmond series, but the first battle chronologically.

The first major engagement of the Seven Days set the precedent for the fighting that would follow. You have a small contingent of Union soldiers occupying a strong defensive position; Lee's plan calls for multiple divisions to coordinate their assaults so as to outflank and destroy the enemy; one or two divisions do all the fighting, abandoning the plan and settling for costly frontal assaults. At least this time, Stonewall Jackson shows up - sort of, anyway: having just marched from the Valley with orders to attack the Union rear, he hears the fighting and promptly sets up camp instead, because of course he does.

The fourth game in our series goes back to the beginning. Though this battle has relatively few special rules, it's very challenging. It's much harder for the johnnies to activate more than a single division at a time, while the yankees find their line stretched precariously thin...

boardgame.name: Adventures of the Kai
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

“The river rapids roar up ahead, threatening to dash your raft against the sharp rocks. Through the spray you can see that the river forks in two. To the left, you hear the cry of some terrible beast. To the right, you can make out the silhouette of River Pirates, waiting in ambush.

What do you do next?”

Welcome to Adventures of the Kai, three epic new adventures for you and your Players to embark upon! These adventures take the intrepid Kai Lords deep into the aptly named Wildlands, south to Ruanon in pursuit of fearsome bandits, and to Toran where they’ll need all their wits about them to solve a mysterious murder.

This book contains three new adventures:

For Richer, For Poorer – Guests of honour at a wedding, the Kai Lords must save the day when the groom is kidnapped by bandits! But as they give pursuit, they find out it might not be quite so straightforward as it seems…

River Pirates of the Dorn – A Sommlending expedition into the Wildlands has gone missing. The Kai Lords must trek deep into the wilderness to find out what has befallen it, in the process stumbling into the machinations of the ambitious River King!

On Wings of Darkness – A tragic chain of events is unleashed when the Kai Lords investigate a gruesome murder. They must hurry to halt a strange new supernatural foe before all of Sommerlund is imperilled.

But that’s not all, for the book also includes plenty of helpful advice for how to write an adventure of your own, as well as techniques and tips for what to do when things go awry!

boardgame.name: Stashed: Accumulated Treasures
boardgame.description:
Stashed - A Solitaire Card Game

The Story So Far...
You step inside your collection room to admire your lovingly collected treasures when you notice that instead of them being neatly organised into their trays they are scattered all over the place. Your precious items are in a mess and you need to get them sorted, luckily you have a system!

You have a deck of item cards that must be organised into designated spaces. If you can complete them all you win!

You also have some special actions that may be used to help you achieve your goal. Stashed is designed to be played by a single player, and can be played in around 15 mins. Co-operative variant rules are also included so you can play with a friend (or three)

boardgame.description:

[The characters] are a group of solar powered robots, on a mission to colonize a distant exoplanet. [Their] goal is to survey the land and build a base to house future human colonists. boardgame.description:
From the publisher:

“This world shall be my hunting grounds for all eternity, and your souls my prey.”
–Vha’shaelhur, Daemon Prince of Slaanesh

The Warp Unleashed is the final War Pack in the Death World cycle for Warhammer 40,000: Conquest.

A massive portal into the Warp has opened in the skies above Nectavus VI. Blood rains down, drenching the ground, and every drop holds a tiny piece of the Immaterium that will gradually overwhelm and possess the entire world. As the power of Chaos grows, distinct forces converge to destroy the servants of the Warp before they can utterly corrupt this world. Before they can triumph, however, these unlikely allies must fight their way through the Chaos warlord—a Daemon Prince of Slaanesh.

The Warp Unleashed is the sixth War Pack in the Death World cycle for Warhammer 40,000: Conquest, and as with the other War Packs in this cycle, you’ll find the focus on the terrifying Death World of Nectavus VI. Plenty of new cards with the Deep Strike keyword give you ways to surprise your opponent with unexpected tactics or reinforcements. Elite units continue to become more dangerous and viable for every faction, and finally, a new Chaos warlord invites you to call upon the Daemonic power of the Warp!

boardgame.name: Masmorra: Dungeons of Arcadia – Monster-Set
Masmorra: Dungeons of Arcadia – Monsters Dice Set
Masmorra: Set de Dés de Monstres
boardgame.description:
The Monsters Dice Set adds a whopping 12 new Monster Dice, as well as new Bosses and Tiles, and the much requested Dice Bags!

There are 8 copies of the new Minor Monsters Dice, adding Harpies, Gargoyles, Rust Insects, Kobolds, Zombies, and Dire Rats to the dungeons of Masmorra! There are also 4 copies of the Major Monster Dice that will bring more diversity to the second level of the dungeon, with the threat of Beastmen, Hydras, Death Knights, Lizards, Medusas, and Manticores!

These dice are mixed with those of the core box and drawn randomly when a tile requires a monster spawn of that given type. To help you out with the process of drawing random dice, and also to help store all your dice, this set comes with two custom Dice Bags, one for Minor Monsters, and another for Major Monsters!

But The Monsters Dice Set doesn't have only dice, it also features a couple of new Bosses, represented by tokens, to haunt your dungeon! Get ready to test your valour against Cun-Ha, the corrupted pharaoh, and Lord Blinkerton, the... whatever that thing is.

boardgame.name: The Good Dinosaur: Le Voyage d'Arlo
The Good Dinosaur: The Great River Adventure
boardgame.description:
Arlo, the young Apatosaur, and Spot, the lively human child, have been swept away by the big river. Can you guide them on their journey back home? Help Arlo and Spot on their adventures up the river. The player who receives the most river cards along the way will be the winner.

Each round, the Arlo & Spot standee is moved to the next river tile segment, which is flipped over. The picture on the tile indicates what challenge Arlo & Spot must overcome this turn; all players get a chance to participate in the challenges, which could involve throwing their character's 'stone' at a bad guy standee trying to knock it over, trying to throw their stones closest to a good guy, trying to get across the rapids first by rolling the two custom color dice and moving the characters matching the rolled colours one step further, etc. Whoever wins each challenge gets to keep that round's river tile.

When Arlo & Spot reach the end segment of the river, whoever has won the most river tiles is the winner!

boardgame.name: Roots of Mali
boardgame.description:
Enter a fascinating fantasy world in which mystical tribes are torn apart by internal strife. Fierce power struggles and cunning strategies lead to epic confrontations deciding who has total supremacy in the Warring Lands.

Roots of Mali is a remarkable challenge for strategists as players compete against each other with characters represented by dice – despite zero luck being involved! By vanquishing an opposing creature, you gain might points equal to the creature's power level. The first player to collect 10 might points wins, and you score by tactically moving creatures and exercising their special powers to outwit your opponent, eliminating their character dice from the board, which represents the Warring Lands.

Roots of Mali is a standalone game that can be combined with its predecessor Light of Dragons for new challenges and even greater replayability. Each tribe consists of six different creatures with unique abilities and distinct power levels. Tribes from both editions can easily be distinguished by the color of their representative dice.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Disney Eye Found It!
boardgame.description:
A card game using the same art of Dreamworks Eye Found It, but with different rules, goals, and mechanics. The card show detailed illustrations on one side and a single item on the other. Each player receives a hand of 5 cards, then a card is drawn to determine the single item all players are trying to locate in their hand. The first player to find the required item gets to discard the card with the item.
The winner is the first player to get rid of all of their cards.

boardgame.name: Battle of the Penguins
boardgame.description:
It's the year 3001, the habitat of the Penguins reduced during the global warming and became very small. The Penguins evolved to less friendly animals and became truculent. Now every piece of ice is important to survive. Several clans fight for there lives. This game is played with two of those clans.

The aim of this game is to survive with as many penguins as possible, attack other penguins and nourishing your Inuit family.

Each player draws a card out a line of three open cards and that card indicates the actions you are allowed to perform. There are three types of actions. Lay down your tiles, move your penguins and attack other penguins. When you fight, you role dice!!
There are 10 types of tiles, most of them with a special effect to be carried out. So be careful where you place your tiles,
it could harm yourself!

Meanwhile you have to support your Inuit family, by slaughtering killer whales, seals and opponent penguins. Every fight will be rewarded whether it is successful or not. It's your effort that is rewarded.

boardgame.name: Klash
boardgame.description:
Each player has a character deck of cards and 3 lives (3 heart tokens). Players simultaneously flip their cards face up the fastest as possible in order to find a special Tech. There are some symbols printed on each Tech cards.

Players go on flipping cards up until they gather all the symbols in a specific order. The first player who does that Klashes his opponents with his Tech and a new round starts.

Most of the Tech cards have special powers that trigger when the Tech is achieved. In addition, each Tech grants points and the first player who scores 10 points wins the game.

If a player fails to achieve his Tech (i. e. they flipped the wrong symbol), he loses 1 life (heart token). When a player has no more life, he's out of the game.

This card game might be the fastest card game of the world!

boardgame.name: The Bird Told Me to Do It
Ptaszki Ćwierkają
boardgame.description:
Make sure your color birds show up the most on the branch and score big. Do what the birds tell you to do and score bigger!

The Bird Told Me To Do It is a point scoring game in which each player adds to a twisting forking tree branch from his hand of cards. Each card shows a number of birds of a certain color. A player can collect a plumage card of a color by adding birds to the branch in that color. When a branch is finished the color showing the most birds scores points for the player owning that color plumage.

Each card also shows an instruction being given by a bird on the card. When a player adds a card to the branch, he performs all instructions given on all cards on the branch from the trunk of the tree all the way out to the card he placed. These instructions can be to draw cards, collect plumage, score cards, add more cards to the branch, remove cards from the branch, or boost the effect of a future card.

Cards in the same color on the branch also boost each other's instructions. Chain lots of cards on a branch for crazy turns! Twist and loop the branch to keep other players from copying your moves!

boardgame.name: Prosperity: Planning Your Future
boardgame.description:
Prosperity: Planning Your Future looks like Monopoly on the surface, but is a much more sophisticated game intended to teach children the realities of earning a living and keeping the family solvent and safe. Each player starts by picking a profession at random, with salaries ranging from 120 pounds a month for a postman to 300 pounds a month for an actor.

Player tokens then proceed around the board with opportunities to make investments in either unit trusts (which pay triple at game end) or a house, to use hire-purchase to buy household appliances, to put money into or take it out of banks and building societies (paying 8%) or Local Council (10%), as well as to encounter Accidents or Unexpected Expenses and to buy a wide variety of Insurance Policies against such ills.

Purchasing a property requires a minimum deposit, surveyors fee and solicitors fee, as well as monthly repayments of about 1% of the mortgage amount. Passing Start provides monthly salary for the occupation less all monthly payments (rent or mortgage, insurance, hire-purchase). The winner is the first to accumulate total assets of 15,000 pounds.

This made-in-England game is undated, but the graphics point to late 1950s or early 1960s (the family father on the box is smoking a cigar and wearing a jacket with cravat). The box claims a copyright, but there is no indication of the copyright owner or publisher, with the possible exception of a small cathedral-like logo on all four sides of the box. The rules and play suggest it might have been produced by a company in the investment or insurance business.

boardgame.name: Squaremino
boardgame.description:
The Squaremino board game is a challenging and addictive abstract game for 2-4 players that uses a unique set of domino-like tiles. Players take turns adding sets and sequences to a public network of tiles, attempting to be the first to play all of their tiles.

Players of various skill levels can all enjoy this game as more casual gamers will enjoy a relaxing social experience and more advanced players will enjoy exploring complex strategies. The game play is a blend of competition and cooperation as players pursue individual goals while jointly building upon a common structure.

The generously-sized game tiles feel delightful to the touch and are pleasing to the ear as they are shuffled together. As the game play progresses, beautiful patterns of colors emerge, creating an elegant work of art by game's end.

boardgame.name: ZORP: Zombie Oblivion Response Pack
boardgame.description:
ZORP is a shoot-em-up strategy game that combines fast-paced action with chess-like strategic maneuvering and decision-making. It's easy to learn and has both recommended and randomized board arrangements.

One player is a zombie master who controls a steadily growing horde of zombies. Every other player is a human who has been infected by the zombie virus. Humans have nine turns to get to a cure. Along the way they will gather weapons and events to help them survive.

In a two/three player game, there is only one cure on the board and in a four player game there are two. This means that in a three/four person game, one human is always guaranteed to not get a cure. Humans will want to work together, at least somewhat in order to overcome the odds, but in the end, one person cannot be rescued, so humans may turn against each other to slow each other down.

Each human begins with one random weapon and their turns consist of two movement phases and an attack phase, which they can use in any order. (Move/Move/Attack, Attack/Move/Move, Move/Attack/Move) A movement is one tile in a non-diagonal direction and an attack lets you use all of the ammo at your disposal during the attack phase. Each weapon has different properties and the ammo is reloaded each turn.

When a human lands on a weapon tile, they add it to their inventory and are able to duel wield weapons. If they land on an event, they trigger it immediately. Some events persist throughout the game (like finding fast shoes, etc.) some are one time use (like finding a live grenade, etc.).

The Zombie Master's turn begins by moving all of the zombies on the board. Different zombie types have different movement abilities. After moving existing zombies, he/she spawns new zombies to add to the board. Certain turns will also trigger a zombie event after the new zombies have been placed on the board. Zombie events are generally good for the Zombie Master, but expert humans can find ways to exploit certain zombie events.

The players take turns until either all the cures have been acquired, or time runs out and none of the turns have been acquired or if the zombie master can zombify all the humans in the game.

boardgame.name: The Ruined City: A Runed Campaign
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Grand City of Middelburg is a vast metropolis that is home to over a million souls... and one hellish demon. This hellion stalks the shadows to prey on the lives of men and feast on their very terror. This ruin of a man has come into the city like a thief in the night and now seems to rule it through fear, yet noone has ever lain eyes upon it and lived. The string of murders left behind in its wake grows more gruesome and horrific as the days tick by and yet there seems to be no end to what this monstrosity has planned for this once serene city. Can you survive the Ruined Man's machinations? Can you survive in a city that is tearing itself apart at the seams? Can you survive when all around you the people turn upon one another in paranoia and suspicion? Can you survive in the Ruined City?

The Ruined City is the first campaign released for The Runed Age setting and takes place in the Grand City of Middelburg as a series of gruesome murders happen and sends this metropolis of a million souls spiralling into panic, paranoia and darkness. The Ruined City is the first of four books in the greater Ruined Man campaign and serves to set up the main characters and events in the campaign, teach the players the unique campaign mechanics and puts them to the test to see if they have what it takes to survive in the dangerous city of Middelburg.



The City of Ruins

The Ruined City is not only an adventure and campaign book. This book also serves as a primer for the city itself. The Grand City of Middelburg was introduced in the Runed Age Corebook as a massive sprawling metropolis, home to a million people and ruled over by corrupt politicians and greedy merchants. Now the Ruined City will take you down onto the streets of Middelburg and show you all the places, buildings, monuments and areas of interest in each district of the city. The Ruined City alone will take you through a whole third of this gargantuan city with nearly a hundred unique locations visited and explored. By the end of the book you will know these parts of Middelburg better than you know your own hometown and you will be able to craft your own adventures and campaigns in and around Middelburg by drawing on the history and culture of the people and locations of these districts. But it isn't all dry reading. Each of the missions in the book is paired to the districts explored in that chapter, meaning that as you read and learn of these places, the campaign will take your through them as well so you can feel and experience them as any NPC in the world would.


The Path to Madness

The Ruined City contains four missions that will test your players to their very limits. Each mission is unique and seemingly separate, yet there is a thread underpinning it all: The Ruined Man. Each mission is as much noir mystery as it is an action adventure and it is up to the players to piece together the "whos", the "whats" and the "whys" of the Ruined Man before he utterly drives the city into madness. If the missions themselves are not enough of a challenge for your players, the Ruined City will show them how the city falls deeper into suspicion and despair the longer the campaign goes on by making it harder for folks to get along and having the desperate people of Middelburg turn to crime just to survive. Now not only do the players have to fulfil their obligations and complete the missions, but they have to do so with the whole city seemingly agains them.

boardgame.name: BaRPG
boardgame.description:
Description from the designer:

BaRPG is the unholy result of a one-night stand between a drinking game and card based RPGs. From the side of RPG, BaRPG has inherited a melange of exciting characters to play, a definitely sexy level system, dice-rolling and booty (Err… I mean epic loot!). From drinking games, it has inherited a series of ridiculous games that will keep you drinking. Though in the end there will be a clear winner, we like to think the true prize is in the friends you will make along the way…

The game is played between 3 to 7 players. Each player receives a character card, and a level and damage tracking card. Every round all players (except whoever last levelled up) roll a dice, highest roll then checks if what was rolled is higher than their current level. If so, that player levels up, reads out their character's power (which is a drinking game), and the group then plays that game. At the end of the game, someone will have to take 'drinks' as well as take damage. The game then enters a market round, where players can 'buy' additional item cards. These item cards can be used at any time during the game, and can either assist players or thwart the efforts of others. The game then returns to a new round of dice rolling.

The first player to reach level 6 wins, and yes there is even an item that can be played against another player to put him/her back to level 1. There are in total 10 characters with associated games, and these characters will swap during the game as part of the item card mechanics. boardgame.name: Wakkawakka
boardgame.description:
Wakkawakka is a turnbased two Player game. The goal is to capture as many cherries (victory points) as possible. Therefore players move their adventurer token in a pacman styled labyrinth.
But just collecting cherries would be to easy. That's why each player also has a hunter to stop the enemy adventurer. Hunters cannot collect cherries, but when they capture the enemies adventurer it is reset to its starting position.

So players have to decide how to spend their 3 move actions each turn on their hunter or adventurer token.

The first player to collect 11 points wins the game.

boardgame.name: Hooligans
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Stupid, wild, hedonistic, and chaotic; goblins are everything man wishes to move beyond. While man can be said to constantly advance and move upwards and forwards, goblins are akin to pigs - content to wallow in mud and filth. Nature was not kind to goblins; they breed like rabbits, have lifespans slightly above a small dog, and explode when exposed to sunlight. Nevertheless, goblins can always be found on the fringes of society, surviving on the cast-off refuse of mankind.

An ancient pact keeps goblins from getting too much underfoot. One night a year humans lock their doors, board up their windows, and allow the goblins to run amok with no consequence. This wild night is the highlight of a goblin’s year, and each crew spends the months leading up to it picking the perfect location, planning glorious acts of recklessness, and scheming to seize the most choice of treasures from the world of man.

Night has fallen. The Van is in perfect running condition, or as good as a van built by goblins can be. The world stretches before you, young goblins. Run wild!

boardgame.name: Crisis
boardgame.description:
From the publisher:

Crisis is a modern game with many innovations like a virtual, generic map, no general certificate or money limits, rounds instead of operating rounds and stock rounds, structure purchases, and signals but without some traditional elements like off-board connections, terrain difficulties, small cities, empty big cities, or privates. This gives the game a new feeling already on the surface. Square tiles are used to simulate subways in a downtown megalopolis.

While once 1830 could be called the premier game of stock manipulation and 1841 is the game with the greatest speed of technological development, now Crisis is the toughest, most complex, and most unpredictable game of business strategy. Measuring complexity is hard but years of testing have produced counter-strategies for every strategy and not enabled me to foresee just one round, what is possible in 1830 or 1841.

So what makes Crisis so tough? First of all, companies can purchase unlimited numbers of foreign shares. This creates complex combines. Second, companies are forced to own more and more foreign shares, what makes good shares scarce. This is an extra duty besides buying a train. Third, foreign assets may only be bought from the or as a director. Fourth, all shareholders can be responsible for under-endowed companies while some might avoid supports and let the director lose his shares even though having supported. Fifth, other shares in such companies may not be given away and can cause more supports. Sixth, half the companies have only certificates that already allow a director change. Seventh, trading many old or new certificates quickly restructures combines, depletes companies, or inflates money. Eighth, the stock market and the round order, which involves players and companies, are particularly flexible. To conclude, dividends are paid only to owned foreign shares.

While the game has a balanced start and good route construction remains important, it becomes more and more essential to excel at wheeling and dealing. Clearly, Crisis is the game of devious business manipulations.

boardgame.name: Medici: The Card Game
メディチ カードゲーム
메디치: 카드 게임
boardgame.description:
Medici: The Card Game is a new design by Reiner Knizia that shares the setting and feel of the classic Medici board game, without using that game's auction mechanisms.

In 15th century Florence, players try to acquire the most valuable goods for their merchant ships by drawing 1-3 cards from a common deck each turn. After drawing, the active player must take the final card they drew and may select one or both of the previous two cards drawn (if available). They then load these commodity cards on their boat. Cards that are not taken remain available to future players. Once a player's boat is full (seven cards with two players, five cards with 3-6 players), they are out of the round and the day is scored.

Players score points for the value of their ships' holds, but also for the number of commodities of each type that they have stored in their warehouse. The highest earning merchant over three days wins the game. Some cards do not take up space on ships, while others contribute to the value of a hold, but cannot be stored in warehouses.

This is the first game to be added to the Medici family of games since Strozzi, released in 2008.

Forgotten Stars is a game of memories, consciousness, and creeping existential dread. You will play the parts of the recorded minds of a number of characters. They have been sent on a mission, a mission they currently have no recollection of. boardgame.name: Sunblink
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Moments are pieces of history, broken and scattered throughout time. The [characters] are able to preview these Moments and use the Sunblink cells to record them permanently. Each Moment is an instance of innovation and is coded with the region and era of its origin. Some Moments are more difficult to recover than others. Moments from the same region and era are more significant findings. Each researcher wants to build the most significant portfolio of recovered Moments and are even willing to steal for the distinction.

User summary:

The game is played as a traditional card game using custom cards; role-playing elements include the character actions and various player decisions about how to assemble a narrative from components dictated by card play. The custom cards are distributed as separate files intended for print-and-play.

boardgame.name: Machines Do Not Understand Dance
boardgame.description:
User summary:

This avant-garde game definitely pushes the boundaries of experimental role-playing. It is presented as a computer program (ironically, with a defect which quickly was pointed out by a reviewer) that simulates what a human dance might be like in computer code (via object manipulation). While the code could theoretically be compiled and executed, the rationale behind the game presentation is to allow an atypical introspection on the nature of gaming, technology, and, perhaps, dancing.

boardgame.name: The Sickle Glitters
boardgame.description:
User summary:

Characters in the game are defined by traits. Play creates custom card artifacts (on blank index cards) that are used throughout the game. The setting of the game is co-opted from a specific historical period, incorporated by reference to a Wikipedia article.

The game was published as a series of tweets, none of which were edited. This process adhered to the Game Chef 2014 theme of "the unbound book". After the final tweet comprising the game was made, the author produced a storify version to place the tweets in a specific non-chronological order to enhance accessibility.

boardgame.name: Platoon Commander: Korea 1950
boardgame.description:
The first historical Platoon Commander module delves into the dynamic early days of the Korean War. The North Korean People's Army (NKPA) is relentlessly marching south, and the United States Army, vastly outnumbered, finds itself fighting a series of desperate battles in an attempt to buy enough time for the Pusan Perimeter to be finished. Chaffees and T-34s, Skyraiders and guerilla attacks; it's all here.

Platoon Commander: Korea 1950 features four tense scenarios:

Task Force Smith: The NKPA armor shrug off everything the Americans threw at them. Can they survive?

Taejon: The 21st Infantry Regiment & 78th Heavy Tank are all that stands between the NKPA and the unfinished Pusan Perimeter.

Chochiwon: The 21st Infantry Regiment faces ten-to-one odds. But US airpower might even the score.

Task Force Lynch: The daring Pusan Perimeter Breakout.

Our Terms and Conditions
1. General
All transactions between Gamers HQ and you, the customer, are subject to the following conditions, which you acknowledge by accepting delivery of your ordered products. These conditions do not affect your statutory rights and in all cases German law applies.
2. Orders and prices
We do our level best to ensure that the information on our website is up-to-date. Please note that offers and prices are subject to change. We work to ensure that our prices are all correct, but cannot be held responsible for accidentally displaying the wrong price of a product.
All prices are quoted in Euros and already include all necessary taxes.
3. Lead times and delivery costs
Our products are delivered directly from our Berlin base, and orders are usually dispatched within two working days. Dispatch and transport are at the expense of the customer. We usually ship orders with DHL but explicitly reserve the right to choose another method of transport. If an order is split into several deliveries, each delivery counts as a separate transaction.
Delivery within Germany is free of charge if your order amounts to a total of 50 euros or more. Below that amount, we charge a one-off fee of 5 euros.
Our products can also be ordered for delivery outside Germany. In that case, an estimate of the delivery costs is added to your order during checkout. Please note that this delivery cost estimate does not necessarily constitute the final amount. We shall contact you personally by email after you have placed your order to present you with delivery options and to quote the final price for delivery costs.
4. Payment options
We currently offer the following three payment options: direct debit from your bank account (only within Germany), bank transfer (prepayment) and PayPal. Once you have placed three orders, we also offer you the option to pay by invoice. Such privileges can, however, be withdrawn should we encounter repeated delays in settling invoices.
5. Cancellations, Refunds & Returns Should you wish to cancel your order, you can do so by notifying us by fax, email, letter or by simply returning your product(s) to Gamers HQ. No questions asked. Please note that such a cancellation has to be done within two weeks after having received your ordered product(s). Should you have already paid for your order, we shall refund those costs to you as soon as we have received your cancellation notification. Please ensure that any products returned are in good condition. If you check the products in a manner that you will have done, for example, in a shop, this is fine. Any other handling of the product(s) might entitle Gamers HQ to some compensation from you, which might in rare cases amount to the original sum paid for the product(s). So should you feel that you might cancel your order by returning the products, please limit your inspection of the products to optical checks and do not use them on a regular basis. If you return your order within two weeks in the above manner, we shall refund you the costs for sending the product(s) back to us (unless your cancelled order amounts less than 20 euros, in which case you as the customer will bear the cost of return postage). Please ensure that you use appropriate packing material when sending back the product(s) — preferably using the original wrapping. Please note that German law, following the EU directive 97/7/EG of 20 May 1997, specifies that the right to return items and receive a full refund is not applicable to the purchase of newspapers, magazines or journals (§312d BGB) as well as the purchase of audio- or video-recordings and software once you have broken the seal of the package. Should we accidently send you the wrong products, please return them to us and we shall refund you the return postage immediately. Any cancellation of an order has to be done in writing (by post, fax or email). 6. Ownership
Please note that ordered products remain our property until you have fully paid for them.
7. Personal data
We are committed to protecting your personal information and will keep the information you entrust to us safely and securely. We may collect information from you to monitor website visitor patterns, so that we can improve our website. We also collect information from you to handle orders, deliver products and services, process payments, communicate with you about orders, products and services, update our records and generally maintain your customer profile with us. However, we shall never sell or share your personal information with third parties. Our customer data — in so far as required to provide the above services and within the limits defined by the data protection laws of Germany (paragraph 26 BDSG) — is saved and handled on a separate, network-independent computer.
8. Other matters
We reserve the right to reject orders without any explanation. Also please note that you as a customer cannot assert a claim against Gamers HQ if, for whatever reason, we are unable to source the item(s) you have ordered. Such cases arise only very exceptionally; we try to ensure that everything we advertise in our web shop is in stock. Where, for whatever reason, we are unable to deliver we promptly refund in full everything you have paid.
9. Limitation of liability: external links
Although we check the content of external links provided on our website, we have no control over or responsibility for these domains to which we provide the links or which link to us. That responsibility solely rests with those who manage the respective domains.
10. Place of jurisdiction
Any disputes arising hereunder will be settled before a Berlin court. We reserve the right to choose the customer's place of jurisdiction instead.
11. Severability clause
If parts of these terms and conditions become ineffective, the remainder of these terms still apply.

boardgame.name: Western Front
boardgame.description:
Western Front is a two player card game where players assume the role of commanders in the armies of the Kaiser's Germany, or the Entente Powers.

Battles are fought over 5 rounds representing the years 1914-1918 and the first player to achieve 3 years (rounds) is the winner.

Cards represent units and can provide attack or defensive values. Each player reveals their units simultaneously to determine net results before the option of playing additional cards. Committing units to the fight and employing sound tactical decisions will help achieve victory, however unpredictable events can dramatically alter the battlefield.

The game is said to have simple rules, allow for interesting decisions and be both quick and fun.

boardgame.name: Croix-Rouge cartes à jouer
boardgame.description:
This game based on UNO, was given for free to blood donors in Belgium.

The objective of the game is to be the first to empty their hands.
In turns, players attempt to play a card by matching the previous card color, number or symbol. If unable to play, players draw a card from the draw pile, and if still unable to play, they pass their turn. Wild and special cards spice things up a bit:

Card "+1" / "+2"
Card "Invert"
Card "Skip turn"
Card "Change color"


Ce jeu basé sur UNO, était donner gratuitement aux donneurs de sang en Belgique

L'objectif du jeu est d'être le premier à se débarrasser de toutes ses cartes. Chacun son tour, les joueurs tentent de jouer une de leur cartes en correspondant à la couleur, le numéro ou symbole de la carte précédente. Si le joueur ne peut pas jouer, il doit prendre une carte de la pioche, et s'il ne peut toujours pas jouer, il passe son tour. Des cartes spéciales rendent le jeu plus intéressant :

Carte "+1" / "+2"
Carte "Inversion"
Carte "Passer son tour"
Carte "Changer de couleur"

boardgame.name: Roman Italy (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
boardgame.description:
This follows the principles of the basic Ticket to Ride game on a special board with special cards and rules. The object of the game is to gain the most points by travelling various routes and outwitting other players. You will need the train pieces and the train cards from either the US or Europe base games (or you can buy them from the Days of Wonder shop.

There is an extra set of Tourist cards each with a value to be earned by visiting that city. These cards are dealt/picked up alongwith tickets in the same quantity and with the same 'keep/dispose' rules. There are multifunctional God cards too. There are also up to 9 bonuses for the end-of-game scoring.

The board does not have any grey tracks or parallel tracks - but you can move forward 2000 years and time-travel to Rotterdam by the Gotthard Base tunnel for extra points.

There are many new options in the rules: exchange all your cards at the start but keep all the new ones: discard 5 cards and pick up 5 new ones, as your turn: and many more. You can also call time when your wagon stock reaches 3, if you want, giving you the advantage of stopping other players completing tickets.

boardgame.name: The Haunted Cave
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In a cave at the base of a tall cliff several hours inland from the shore lies the treasure of a once famous pirate, Martyn Whiteskull. The exact location of the treasure is unknown but whenever a piece washes down the river to the village of Frokow, Martyn’s ghost appears to torment those in possession of it. In addition to being haunted by Martyn’s ghost, the cave is now the den of a pack of wolves that have lived there for decades and don’t like intruders.

Born the son of a successful merchant family, Martyn Karnak suffered from partial albinism that left the skin on his face and neck a pale white and his eyes read. This combined with the lack of hair on his body gave him an appearance that did not work well in the merchant community. Leaving that life, he eventually ended up a pirate where he was known as Martyn Whiteskull. Moderately successful, he lost his life in the process of hiding a portion of his treasure and his ghost haunts the treasure to this day.

boardgame.name: Borderlands 3
boardgame.description:
Welcome to Borderlands 3

At the hard edge of the galaxy lies a group of planets ruthlessly exploited by militarized corporations. Brimming with loot and violence, this is your home—the Borderlands. Now, a crazed cult known as The Children of the Vault has emerged and is spreading like an interstellar plague. Play solo or co-op as one of four unique Vault Hunters, score loads of loot, and save the galaxy from this fanatical threat.

Choose Your Vault Hunter

Play as one of four all-new, deeply customizable Vault Hunters—the ultimate treasure-seeking badasses of the Borderlands. Customize your Vault Hunter with tons of personalization options and use their distinct skill trees to tailor abilities to your preferred playstyle.

Face a Fanatical Threat

The Calypso Twins, Troy and Tyreen, are ruthless new media cult leaders who have convinced the bandit clans of the Borderlands that they are their Gods and Saviors. They consider the power of the Vaults to be their birthright and are leading their weaponized worshippers, The Children of the Vault, on a crusade to claim it—and only you have the arsenal and allies to take them down.

Experience Co-Op Mayhem

Team up with other Vault Hunters online, or with two-player split-screen on console. Your whole crew will be able to deal meaningful damage—regardless of your respective character levels—through our handy Level Syncing system. You can even opt to play with loot instancing enabled so that you each get your own level-appropriate weapon drops.

Lock, Load, LOOOOT!

There are over one billion guns in Borderlands 3, and every fight is an opportunity to add to your arsenal. Some guns launch exploding sawblades, some never need to be reloaded, others grow legs and pursue enemies on foot when you throw them. Having trouble choosing? Rarity ratings and item scores make it easy to compare the power of your pickups at a glance, but you can also tell a lot about a weapon and its functionality based on its manufacturer. Check out the manufacturer details below:

Discover Extraordinary Worlds

Your Borderlands 3 adventure begins on the familiar desert planet of Pandora from previous Borderlands games, but your journey doesn’t stop there. You’ll also travel to other worlds aboard your very own spaceship, Sanctuary III—a backwater swampland, a futuristic city, and a picturesque monastery are among the new environments you can explore.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Adapt
boardgame.description:
Adapt is a highly strategic survival card game where you take on not only the environment, but your closest friends. Players take turns facing challenges on the island, exploring, hunting, and deciding when to betray the other players all while they are hunting down the precious relics to win the game. You can avoid dangerous misadventures by collecting and holding onto the right supplies, like the fanny pack!

At the beginning of each player's turn, they must draw an action card that they must play..the island gives them no choice! Players then take turns rolling a 4-sided die for the actions they can perform. During their turn they can choose from 5 different actions: Gathering, Exploring, Stealing, Attacking, or playing a card's action from their hand! To perform these actions, the player must roll the 20-sided die and get a 10 or higher (for attacking, gathering, or exploring) to be successful, or a 15 or higher for stealing! As the game progresses, the players must collect all three relics and keep hold of all 3 to win! It's either holding the relics, or be the last survivor standing.

boardgame.name: Le Prochain Raid
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The campaign always lasts seven nights and seven days. The game master needs to keep a count of the number of night and day phases played to determine if a raid occurs during a phase and to end the campaign.

The game ends on the seventh day. After determining where the bombs exploded on the seventh night, NPCs should tell the characters that a portion of the inhabitants have decided to try to evacuate the city and cross the desert. Ask each player why his or her character joins the voyage or remains to continue the defense of the city. If all characters do not make the same decision, the game ends with a farewell scene. Otherwise, end the game on a scene featuring the exodus from the city or the result of the continued resistance.

boardgame.name: Mistfall: Sand & Snow
boardgame.description:
Sand and Snow is an expansion that will enhance your Mistfall and Heart of the Mists experience with a set of 110 brand new cards, you can add to any of one of the sets, or use when you mix them.

What is Sand and Snow?

Let’s start with a new type of Enemy: the Lieutenant. Easily recognizable by lacking a Resolve value, a Lieutenant is an alternate version of an existing Enemy which, when eliminated, allows you to take a Reward card right out of the display. Most Enemies appearing in Mistfall and Heart of the Mists will see their Lieutenant version in the Sand and Snow expansion.

New opportunities to receive Reward cards call for (you guessed it!) more Rewards. And you will get a nice big cache of brand new General Rewards. I’ve noticed over the last year that many of Mistfall fans wanted more cool loot, and besides bringing some to the Heart of the Mists box, you can now get an even greater number of new weapons, armour and arcane items to use against the Mists.

Sand and Snow will also feature a few new Allies, and a set of Special Event cards, drawn at specific times during the game, becoming essentially more permanent versions of Encounters. If you can beat them within a few turns of the game, you might be rewarded for your effort, and if you decide to ignore them, they will come back to bite you!

boardgame.name: Das Distanzreiten
boardgame.description:
This game is about a horse race from Berlin to Viena and vice versa in 1892. One space represents 10 Kilometers. Movement is determined by a 18-sided die. The die results are as follows:
blank side: 1 space forward (rider leads his horse on foot, 6x)
Schritt: 2 spaces forward (pace, 2x)
Trab: 3 spaces forward (trot, 2x)
Galopp: 4 spaces forward (2x)
Carrieré: 5 spaces forward (1x)
Verirrt: 1 space backward (lost, 1x)
Gestürzt: stay (fallen, 1x)
Rast: stay and pass a turn (rest, 2x)
Lahm: drop out of the game or start again at space 1 (lame, 1x)

The game is probably from the 1890s.

boardgame.name: The Game of Rough Riders
boardgame.description:
This 1890 game by Edgar O. Clark is part of the publisher's Tokalon series and should not be confused with the 1900 Parker Brothers game The Rough Riders, which cashed in on Teddy Roosevelt's famous charge up San Juan Hill. Edgar O. Clark describes its game in the rules as simply "illustrating the wild life in the far West".

It is a simple spin and move game, with a few special spaces (Charge, Run Away, Ditch, Halt, Thrown and Wire Fence) that provide pluses or minuses. A piece that lands on another swaps places (sending the other back), and the four corner circles are safety points where bumping is not allowed. First player back to the start wins.

boardgame.name: ACTOP: Ancient Construct Tower of Philosopher
KOZO
古代建築「賢者の塔」
boardgame.description:
ACTOP: Ancient Construct Tower of Philosopher, a.k.a. 古代建築「賢者の塔」 or KOZO, is a three-dimensional stacking game in which players build chimney-shaped towers out of polycubes placed onto a board. One round is composed of the two actions of placing one of the twelve polycubes and a balance stone within the confines of the 8 square-gridded base. The cubes of the positioned polycubes dictate the points awarded.

If a player's tower topples, they lose the game. The game ends when a player's tower topples over or if all the available polycubes have been placed. At the end of the game, the player with the highest score wins.

This game is a development of the designer's earlier game Ancient Construct. Since the raw materials were no longer available to make Ancient Construct, the designer revised the game, introducing a strategic element and expanding play to six players.

Publisher's summary
ポリキューブを煙突状に塔を建てるようにボード上に配置していく立体積み上げゲームです。1手番はポリキューブとバランス石を置く2つのアクションで構成されます。配置したポリキューブのキューブ数が得点となります。
途中で塔を倒したプレーヤーは負けとなります。塔を倒した時と全てのポリキューブが配置された時点でゲームオーバーとなります。ゲームオーバー時点で一番得点の高いプレーヤーが勝ちとなります。

boardgame.name: Shattered Vista
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a 40 x 40 inch, Battlemap of Shattered Vista , it has Hex, Square and No Overlays, it also includes the VTT files for online play.

“Those that lived above lost this place long ago. But now they have returned to take it back. They won’t regain this place without a fight. “—Voleman Leader

Shattered Vista is a single level exterior map of a mostly intact mansion covered with overgrowth in the north. A crack in the earth bisects the map and has since filled with water. The courtyard has a building that was leveled by the quake.

Shattered Vista is intended for use in a post-post-apocalyptic game (one where a disaster has occurred and the land has started to recover). It can also be used in modern games as the location of a past earthquake or even a lost world type of scenario beneath the surface of the world.

Adventure hook for use with this map:

Temple of the Volemen: The volemen prayed to their Earth God for a new temple. The god answered as a massive earthquake swallowed up a building from the world above and sent it underground. In reverence to their god, the volemen put phosphorescent moss in the chamber and diverted an underground river to go through the crack in the earth in the middle of the temple square. Soon plant life flourished and grew over the stone courtyard, the flattened building, and the still standing Volemen Temple to their Earth God.

The player characters are mutant or human survivors from the world above. A sudden quake or sinkhole sucks them below the surface. The volemen rush to the temple to defend it against the invaders. A twist on this could be the player characters are the volemen instead when their home is suddenly invaded by mutants or men.

boardgame.name: Lis: Gra Karciana
boardgame.description:
Lis: Gra Karciana is a card game created based on the comic book "Lis" published by Wydawnictwo Sol Invictus. Its action takes place in the today Poland and derive from such genres as criminal, thriller or superhero.

The are 66 cards in the deck, which will cause the gameplay to be full of twists and turns. On each of them there are illustrations kept in the style of the comic book "Lis". In the "Lis: Gra Karciana" players will be able to play as one of four comic book characters, which must collect the appropriate goals.

There are different type of cards: character, goal and action cards. Each player receives 1 character card face down, 1 goal card and 3 action cards. All remaining cards are mixed together and shuffled. In your turn you can do 2 moves from the following ones: draw a card, play an action card, discard 2 cards from your hand to draw 1 card from the discard pile. The card hand limit is 7 cards.

At any moment if another player is playing an action card, you can block its effect by saying "stop" and discarding one goal card from your hand. Other players can block your "stop" by doing the same.

You win immediately if at any point you manage to collect 4 out of 5 goal cards matching (giving 3 points) your character. If nobody was able to collect 4 dedicated goal cards, the game ends after the turn of the player which drew the last card from the deck. In this case the players will sum the points gained from the goal cards based on the scoring from their character cards. The player with the biggest score wins.

boardgame.name: Boyne Class Replenishment Ship
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Gypsy Knights Games is proud to present the fourteenth entry in our line of products dedicated to the starships of Clement Sector.

A successful support vessel with a long service history, the Boyne-class was designed for use by the Royal Navy but was a very successful export even before the ship entered service, eventually serving in national navies, system navies, and defense forces across Clement Sector.

“I think we have an important role, someone has to keep providing stuff to throw at the bad guys.” - Leutnant Hannah Schmidt, Senior supply officer, HFS James Joyce, Wellington c2339 CE

As part of the United Kingdom’s Ministry of Defence’s hull procurement program for the planned expansion of the Royal Navy a new class of mid-size replenishment ships were put into service in 2282. A total of twenty of the new Boyne-class replenishment ships were authorized for construction. The lead ship, HMS Boyne had only just been commenced when orders began to be sought from the United States, India, Australia, Russia and France who were all looking at newer, larger replenishment vessels to replace those currently in service.

Ships of Clement Sector 14: Boyne-class Replenishment Ship comes complete with beautiful views of the ship. The Boyne is presented with full deckplans and statistics to make your use of our product simple, easy and fun. In addition, the ship comes with a set of adventure hooks to get your characters right into the action as well as a short story written by Bradley Warnes.

This volume also includes the Aranui-class Medium Cargo Vessel. The Aranui is a civilian variant of the Boyne which was licensed originally to Anderson and Felix to provide full maintenance and refit. As they had a full set of design plans it was decided to produce a civilian version of the Boyne squarely aimed at small merchant shipping companies and wealthier owner/captains.

Though designed specifically with our Clement Sector setting in mind, these ships could easily be used in any science fiction setting.

boardgame.name: Race
boardgame.description:
Four Knonsters compete in a race in order to find out who is the fastest Knonster. Is it the anxious Rithle, the snappy Aristas, the self-confident Celya or the devious Elaari? Choose your two Favorites and help them to get a good rank in the race.

Gameplay:
The starting player is chosen randomly. Then, starting with the starting player, each player in clockwise order plays one of his cards and executes the instructions of the card. In most cases this means, that a certain Knonster will be moved forward a few steps. But there are cases where the card does not have an effect in the current game situation; in that case, no Knonster is moved. If a Knonster crosses the finish line after position 60, it will be placed on the best still available place on the podium. If a player has fewer than 5 hand cards, the player draws a card from the draw pile (if there are any cards left).

End of Game:
The game ends immediately after the third Knonster has crossed the finish line. Theoretically it can also happen, that the draw deck is depleted when a player is about to draw a card, but fewer than 3 Knonsters have reached the goal. In that case, the game also ends, but only for the Knonsters which have reached the goal the points will be distributed.

boardgame.name: Space Connection
boardgame.description:
Space Connection is a two-player deduction game. Each player has a two-part board, with one part being used to set up their "planets" and the other for the opponent's attempts to find them.

Each player has twenty plastic planet pegs which need to be placed in exactly nine groups of contiguous pegs (abstractly representing the Solar System's planets). Each player also has pegs representing lasers and reconnaissance ships of different strengths.

The ships can be placed to investigate one space, one space plus the six adjacent spaces, or all spaces in one of the triangles the board is divided into. A ship is only returned if its space actually contains a planet peg, otherwise it remains on the opponent's board and cannot be used again. The lasers are only useful when at least two have been placed in a line, as they reveal planets in all spaces between them.

The first player to find all twenty opposing pegs is the winner.

boardgame.name: In the Towers of the Sun, the Depths of Shadow, We Dance
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

In the Towers of the Sun, the Depths of Shadow, We Dance is a game set in a solarpunk future gone not-right; the solar-power-collecting-and-using nanotech that could have set the whole world free has instead made a greater division than ever between those with power (literally) and those without. Those who live in the high towers, whose hyper-efficient collectors and reflectors feed the nanotech batteries, can power all the machines that make their lives convenient with their own bodies.

Below them, in the shadows, live the Underdwellers, who cannot access nearly as much power by themselves; instead, they must spend their lives controlling what little power they get to its greatest effectiveness, and share power when there is something they need that is greater than what one of them can provide.

From the team behind The Legend of Zelda: Majora's Mask 3D comes a daring new adventure that expands on everything RPG fans love about the genre. As a chosen Seedling, your mission is to build a prosperous oasis by working with your partner, lsuna. boardgame.name: HELLO TAIWAN
boardgame.description:
HELLO TAIWAN is a card game about KUSO(funny) Taiwan's native affairs. There are so many dumbfounding things, complex issues of history and ethnic groups in Taiwan.
We carefully designed for each character's appearance , skills and features in the game to transform serious social events into funny cardset ability.
Let's play the game with smile and enjoy it !

[Component]
Game BoardX1
CardsX200 (include Minions and Spells)

[How to play]
1. Shuffle the cards and deal 30 cards to each players as their own deck.
2. Decide which player will go first randomly.
3. Each player draw 4 random cards from their own deck.
4. Each players have their turns alternately. At the start of each playes's turn one card is drawn from their deck and added to their hand. At the first turn of each players, they have 1 Skill Point (SP) ,then at the second turn of each players, they have 2 Skill Point (SP) ,and so on.
5.During your turn, you may play any of your cards, including summoning minions, casting spells. Playing a card will consume the amount of SP stated in the top-left corner of the card. You are also able to command your minions to attack opponent's minions or player.

[Minions]
Minions remain on the board after entering play and only leave when destroyed. Minions may not attack on the turn they enter play, but may attack each turn afterward.

[Spells]
Spells are cards which change the state of play, dealing damage, healing wounds, or buffing Minions.

[Winning the game]
A player wins the game when he reduces opponent's player to zero life.

哈囉臺灣是一款本土的KUSO時事卡牌遊戲。 臺灣有太多讓人哭笑不得的事情，有太多歷史與族群等複雜的問題，在遊戲中，我們針對每­一位角色精心設計外型、技能及特性，讓嚴肅社會事件，轉化成有趣的牌組功能，就讓我們­滿懷笑容的參與，並且享受其中吧。
